Detailed Description

cvmx_pki_cl::_smem#

This register initializes the SMEM, which configures the parse engine. These CSRs are used by the PKI parse engine and other PKI hardware.

Inside the SMEM are the following parse engine registers. These registers are the preferred access method for software: * PKI_CL()_STYLE()_CFG * PKI_CL()_STYLE()_CFG2 * PKI_CL()_STYLE()_ALG

To avoid overlapping addresses, these aliases have address bit 20 set in contrast to this register; the PKI address decoder ignores bit 20 when accessing PKI_CL()_SMEM().

Software must reload the PKI_CL()_SMEM() registers upon the detection of PKI_CL()_ECC_INT[SMEM_SBE] or PKI_CL()_ECC_INT[SMEM_DBE].

For each legal j, PKI_CL(i)_SMEM(j) must be configured identically for i=0..1.
